name: Greatest Hits 2004 - "Fantasy Album" Online Trivia | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
The first track of the album is a lively number, these are the opening lyrics.

"Conversation got heavy, she had me feelin' like she's ready to blow!
She saying come get me, come get me, 
So I got up and followed her to the floor, she said baby let's go, 
When I told her I said ..."

What is the title of this track?
questions.explanation:
Yeah!.

	These lyrics come from "Yeah!" the US Chart topping single by Usher featuring Lil Jon and Ludacris. In 2004 Usher spent a phenomenal 19 consecutive weeks at #1 in the US charts.

questions.text:
Track two is a wistful song. But who had a hit with these words in 2004?

"Well, I will go down with this ship 
And I won't put my hands up and surrender."
questions.explanation:
Dido.

	Dido got to #36 with "White Flag" in the US 2004 End of Year Chart.Born in London in 1971 Dido's full name is Florian Cloud de Bounevialle Armstrong."White Flag" appears on Dido's "Life for Rent" album.

questions.text:
Here is the chorus of the album's third track.

"I don't mind spending everyday
Out on your corner in the pouring rain 
Look for the girl with the broken smile 
Ask her if she wants to stay awhile."

Which group had a hit in 2004 with these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Maroon 5.

	The lyrics come from Maroon 5's hit single "She Will Be Loved".The song was written by group members Adam Levine and James Valentine and features on the album "Songs About Jane".

questions.text:
Track four was a big hit for a female singer in 2004. But which word is missing from the following lyrics?

"With a taste of your lips 
I'm on a ride 
You're ______ 
I'm slipping under 
With a taste of poison paradise 
I'm addicted to you."
questions.explanation:
toxic.

	Britney Spears sang these words on the song "Toxic". She had sold more the 40 million albums while still a teenager. "Toxic" comes from Britney's 2004 album "In The Zone".

questions.text:
The next track has a familiar ring about it. Can you identify the band?

"I'm tired of being what you want me to be 
Feeling so faithless, lost under the surface 
Don't know what you're expecting of me 
Put under the pressure of walking in your shoes..."
questions.explanation:
Linkin Park.

	Lyrics from Linkin Park's single "Numb" which featured at #33 in the US End of Year Chart. This track appears on the groups "Meteora" album.Linkin Park's 2001 album "Hybrid Theory" sold more than 17 million copies.

questions.text:
This track received loads of radio plays in 2004. What is the title?

"It's funny how I find myself in love with you 
If I could buy my reasoning I'd pay to lose 
One half won't do 
I've asked myself 
How much do you commit yourself?"
questions.explanation:
It's My Life.

	No Doubt, fronted by Gwen Stefani, hit big with "It's My Life" in the summer of 2004.  The song was written by Mark Hollis.

questions.text:
Can you identify the title of track seven which features a powerful female vocalist?

"And I wonder if you know 
How it really feels 
To be left outside alone 
When it's cold out here."
questions.explanation:
Left Outside Alone.

	Anastacia, full name Anastacia Newkirk, sang these words in the song "Left Outside Alone".  This track was lifted from the self titled album "Anastacia".

questions.text:
What band is responsible for my fantasy album's track eight, which is destined to remain popular for many years? 

"1 - 2 - 3 - 4 
My baby don't mess around 
Because she loves me so 
And this I know for sure."
questions.explanation:
OutKast.

	These lyrics come from US rap duo OutKast's 2003/4 monster hit "Hey Ya!".This single made it to #8 in the US 2004 End of Year chart.

questions.text:
What word is missing from these lyrics which are chanted at the start of track nine?

"My ______ brings all the boys to the yard 
And they're like 
It's better than yours
Damn right it's better than yours
I can teach you
but I have to charge."
questions.explanation:
milkshake.

	Sassy US hip-hopster Kelis appeared in the End of Year Chart at #41 with "Milkshake".

questions.text:
The final track is a gentle number. By whom was it performed?

"Some people live for the fortune 
Some people live just for the fame 
Some people live for the power, yea 
Some people live just to play the game."
questions.explanation:
Alicia Keys.

	Alicia Keys charted in 2004 with these lyrics from the song "If I Ain't Got You".Written by Alicia, the track features on the album "The Diary Of Alicia Keys".
